definitions.definition: An incident or event that disgraces or damages the reputation of the persons or organization involved.
definitions.example: Their affair was reported as a scandal by most tabloids.
The incident brought considerable scandal to his family.

definitions.definition: Widespread moral outrage, indignation, as over an offence to decency.
definitions.example: When their behaviour was made public it caused a great scandal.

definitions.definition: Religious discredit; an act or behaviour which brings a religion into discredit.
Something which hinders acceptance of religious ideas or behaviour; a stumbling-block or offense.

definitions.example: According to village scandal, they weren't even married.

definitions.definition: To treat opprobriously; to defame; to slander.
